co-op de practica de tiro con zombies por doquier... sirve para pasar un rato.

a ver; es cooperativo que sirve para pasar un rato con amigos pero que no tiene ni gusto si lo juegas solo asi que si no tienes amigos para jugar olvidalo.. ah por cierto su online esta super muerto peor que zombie.

historias no hay mÃ¡s de lo que uno puede deducir.. solo escenarios vinculados entre si, algo asi como una sutil analogia a los niveles en un gran mundo que conforman una 'historia', son como seis mundos.

es un juego que se le pudo haber sacado un provecho increible pero se le ha tirado por la basura para dar importancia al cooperativo que basicamente se puede resumir en modo campaÃ±a para jugar con amigos.

..pero veamos, hay un par de modos de juegos;

- CampaÃ±a; los niveles en sus mundos que puede ser con la computadora o co-op con amigos.. lo que en realidad es lo unico que vale la pena.
- Enfrentamientos; en cual alternas entre supervivientes y zombies especiales en cual lo unico novedoso es que puedes ser zombie pero en los mismos niveles y mundos que en las campaÃ±as.
- Supervivencia; eliges un nivel de alguno de los mundos para resistir spams de zombies por un tiempo que tienes que ir superando cada vez pero que Todos se las han ingeniado para resistir hasta dos horas gracias a los bugs de los niveles y escenarios.

los mandos estan comodos y se siente docil a las maniobras de accion.. pero no sirven demasiado cuando mas o menos la mitad de los zombie son lerdos y se les puede dar a unos cien metros de distancia, incluso es tan asi que puedes hacer un speedrun al refugio sin demasiados dramas.

aqui rescato que las balas sean ilimitadas en las armas mas poderosas porque le da mas adrenalina a las situaciones aunque la variedad de armas sea bastante mediocre.

las artes, los vinculos entre los niveles para crear los mundos se notan con bastante trabajo pero se caen en detalles.

la musica va de la mano con la accion pero la accion va de la mano con un error increible de programacion pues cada suceso de accion esta vinculado solo a un tipo de musica, asi.. tras una hora de juego vas a saber que cuando suena un tipo de musica sucede solo una cosa y no otra.. pero asi se vuelve bastante monotono para tratarse de un juego que se basa principalmente en la accion.

solo lo recomendaria para pasar un rato porque por co-op u online encuentras cosas bastante mas entretenidas.
I LOVE L4D the only part i dont like is when bill dies in the sacrifice and you can see that he did die in the passing! i really woldve rathered francis go first.

Left 4 Dead hat mir stets gefallen, weil man dieses Spiel immer wieder mal zwischendurch spielen kann. Man muss sich nicht extra dafÃ¼r Zeit nehmen. Es ist zwar ein wenig in die Jahre gekommen, aber es soll bzw. brauch ja auch nicht das Wochenende oder den Feierabend ausfÃ¼llen. Man bekommt das, was man erwartet: Zombies wegballern. Und obwohl es aufgrund seines Alters nicht vergleichbar anspruchsvoll wie aktuelle Titel ist, sollte man die Schwierigkeit nie unterschÃ¤tzen. Besonders hart kÃ¶nnen gemoddete Server sein. Hier brandet einem oftmals ununterbrochen oder in Wellen der untote Mob entgegen. AuÃŸerdem bietet dieses Spiel einige Modis wie Ãœberleben an, bei dem man so lange wie mÃ¶glich gegen Zombiewellen durchhalten muss. Es gibt fÃ¼r dieses Spiel sehr sehr viele benutzererstellte Maps, die man sich in seinen Steampfad kopieren muss. Da viele Spieler solche Maps benutzen, muss man auf solchen auch nie lang "allein", also mit der KI zocken. Oder man holt sich Kumpels dazu. Dieses Spiel kann ich auf jeden Fall empfehlen.

Zombi tÃ©mÃ¡jÃº jÃ¡tÃ©k. Egyik kedvenc tÃ©mÃ¡m. 4 szemÃ©lyes csapat a horda ellen. AjÃ¡nlÃ¡s mindenkinek!

Played through all the campaigns, got about 8 hours out of it. There's a lot more to the game than campaigns though, and I'm excited to experience them. Shredding through hordes of zombies is extremely satisfying and enjoyable. The maps feel open and natural despite being quite linear. There is no real story to the game, but the conversations and synergy between the characters are interesting. Nothing in the game really bothered me either.

Left 4 Dead ist der klassische Splatter schlecht hin! Viel FlieÃŸband-TÃ¶ten in der Zombieapokalypse. Ob alleine oder mit Freunden ein HeidenspaÃŸ. Technisch wirkt das Spiel einfach, der Titel hat ja auch schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel und erinnert mechanisch sehr an Counter Strike Source oder Dead Island. Die Mini-Storys haben es auf jeden Fall in sich. 5 Mini-Kampagnen (Dauer jeweils zwischen 30 und 90 Minuten) mit dem einen Ziel zu Ã¼berleben bescheren dem Spieler auf jeden Fall Freude und Lust am BlutvergieÃŸen wild gewordener Zombies. Die Level sind teils einfach, aber unterhaltsam aufgebaut, sodass keine Chance fÃ¼r Langeweile bleibt. Definitiv ein elektrisierender Horrorshooter.

Der groÃŸe Nachteil ist eben, dass die SpielatmoshÃ¤re gegen null geht. Wo keine Emotionen sind, ist auch kein GefÃ¼hl. Das ist im Spiel wirklich nicht vorhanden. :D Einfaches Gemetzel. Dennoch sind die Credits immer lustig aufgebaut.

7/10 fÃ¼r Horror und Koop-Action

P.s. Ein Spiel, das einen Gegner-NPC zur Videospiel-Legende gemacht hat: Die Witch! :))))))))))))))
En si es un gran juego de supervivencia y la tematica de zonbies que tiene la hace aun mas interesante ya que le aÃ±ade ese toque de suspenso y adrenalina que tanto nos gusta

Left 4 Dead, Valve'Ä±n zombi kÄ±yametinin ortasÄ±nda geÃ§en Co-op FPS oyunu. Her ne kadar single bir Valve oyununun (Half-Life 3 Confirmed?) yerini tutamasa da bu oyun tek kelimeyle harika. Birbirinden farklÄ± kiÅŸiliklere sahip karakterleri, her ne kadar oyuna mÃ¼kemmel bir hikaye katamasa da iÅŸi biraz ilginÃ§leÅŸtiriyor. VuruÅŸ hissiyatÄ± ise mÃ¼kemmel. Tamam, 2. oyundaki yakÄ±n dÃ¶vÃ¼ÅŸ silahlarÄ± yok ama zombileri vurunca cidden vurduÄŸunuzu hissediyorsunuz. Bu oyun, arkadaÅŸlarÄ±nÄ±zla oynayabileceÄŸiniz en iyi oyunlardan birisi. AslÄ±nda, bu oyun iÃ§in evet veya hayÄ±r basmak konusunda kararsÄ±z kalmÄ±ÅŸtÄ±m, Ã§Ã¼nkÃ¼ bu oyundaki bÃ¶lÃ¼mlerin hepsi 2. oyunda da var. Ancak, bu bir Valve oyunu ve bu adamlarÄ±n oyunlarÄ± beni hiÃ§ bir zaman hayal kÄ±rÄ±klÄ±ÄŸÄ±na uÄŸratmadÄ±. Bu yÃ¼zden evet, oyunu tavsiye ediyorum.

Left 4 Dead, a excellent co-op game.

Left 4 Dead is Valve's very own cooperative zombie FPS released in 2008. the game features the zombie apocalypse as it setting, although instead of the zombies being undead they are infected with a virus. This game proved to be very successful as the better known sequel Left 4 Dead 2, came out a year later.

Starting with gameplay. You and three other players/bots take control of the four playable survivors, fighting your way though multiple campaigns, from safehouse to the recuse. To protect yourself and others from the horde, there is a good selection of weapons, throwables, and healing items. Obviously, the main enemies are the near endless amount of infected. While they are weak, their main threat comes from the sheer amount of them. As, well with the Common Infected, there are Special Infected with special traits that usually require teamwork to defeat. To handle the infected, the Left 4 Dead games feature a "Director" which controls items and spawns in the Common and Special Infected, as well as the Tank and Witch encounters, two more powerful Special Infected. This system makes each campaign different the next time you play it as items and zombies will be in different places. Also Included are other gamemode besides the standard campaign, such as Singleplayer and Versus, to shake up the gameplay. 

However, compared to its sequel, there are some things lacking. First, there are every few weapons, which could get boring as you will be using the same group of weapons over and over again. Second is that, pretty much everything from this game was ported to Left 4 Dead 2, rendering little point to play the original.

Overall, Left 4 Dead is a great game to play with friends, with cooperative gameplay and a bunch of infected to kill. Unfortunately, due to the fact the campaigns were ported to the sequel, there is very little reason to play this game. But it still holds up its gameplay elements and is still enjoyable to play. Now excuse me, I need to grab some pills.
I like to fight zombies just like I like to play pornographic games.

I recommend this game only based on the fact that itâ€™s a good game on itâ€™s own. I say that because I feel like Left 4 Dead 2 upgrades on this game in almost every single way imaginable, so technically I wouldnâ€™t recommend it because I would just recommend Left 4 Dead 2 instead.

The infected in this game donâ€™t punish camping strategies as much as the Spitter does. Even though the Spitter is one infected that has to wait through the spawn cycle to come around, thereâ€™s always a voice in the playerâ€™s head scaring them from going into a cramped closet to hold out a horde because they know a spitter may be spawn nearby and will mean either a lot of damage or even death.

There are more guns in L4D2, each of them feeling different enough that players will have their own personal favorites based on what nuanced differences there are between guns, while still maintaining the obvious differences between different classes of weapons like shotguns and assault rifles.

The atmosphere is one of the things that brought up most often as being superior to the sequel, but I have to say I disagree. Horror games are at their most atmospheric when you have very little to defend yourself with. The first Resident Evil games excell at this because youâ€™re constantly scrounging around for any bullet or herb you can find. Thatâ€™s why Resident Evil V was such a disappointment for many fans, as it retained that â€œsurvivalistâ€ gameplay while changing to atmosphere to an over the top action movie. Lack of resources and defense options is a very consistent element in horror games, which is why games like Amnesia or Outlast provide you pretty much no defense against the monsters other than running and hiding. 

Left 4 Dead is not a game where resources are lacking. Health is spawned on a regular basis, often times in areas that are completely in your way, but even more plentiful if you spend a bit of time looking. Each individual character carries enough ammo to make a hardened military vet green with envy, and youâ€™ll typically come across full loaded guns or ammo piles every few minutes. Pipe bombs and molotovs are plentiful, you tear through the infected without much issue, they common infected are so plentiful that theyâ€™re somewhat oversaturated and keep each individual infected from seeming like a legitimate threat. To bring up Resident Evil again, one zombie could do a good chunk of damage on its own, so each one you saw was an enemy that needed to be taken seriously. The commons in this game are so useless on their own that theyâ€™re really scary. Overwhelming in large numbers? Sure. But not scary. All of these things make the horror element the first game is going for irrelevant at best, and contrasting to the gameplay at worst. This is a problem  L4d2 doesnâ€™t suffer from because it embraces the action packed gameplay. The characters take the situation less seriously, there are more explosives, the settings are more bright and colorful, they have a finale in which you play extremely loud rock music with ridiculously dumb lyrics for godâ€™s sake. The second game knows exactly what it is, where I always felt the first game couldnâ€™t come to terms with the fact that it wasnâ€™t scary.


Left 4 dead 2 now has all of the Left 4 Dead 1 maps as part of their standard campaigns. Though the Left 4 Dead 2 infected werenâ€™t balanced around Left 4 Dead 1 maps, Iâ€™m almost tempted to laugh in the face of anyone that considers that an issue because of how poorly Left 4 Dead Versus mode is balanced in the first place.

With all of that said, there are two things this game does better than the first one.

First off, lighting tanks on fire makes them run faster than survivors. Itâ€™s always an internal debate on whether to light a tank on fire in this game because it could do more harm to the survivors than good. In Left 4 Dead 2, the decision is almost always to throw the molotov at him, as long as it wonâ€™t block off your only escape route.

Second, the map design in the first one is better. I mentioned I enjoy the settings in the sequel more, and thatâ€™s still true, but Left 4 Dead 1 had occasional â€œpoint of no returnâ€ where survivors would drop down into an area with no way to backtrack. These were always crucial attacking points for infected in versus mode, as theyâ€™d almost always manage a kill on a survivor if they could catch them alone in this area.

Left 4 Dead 2 has these as well.

Oh boy, does it have them.

That gimmick was used somewhat sparingly in the first game, but is done to death in Left 4 Dead 2. Almost every chapter seems to contain one of these points of no return. This is made worse by the fact that, in Versus, both teams tanks spawn in slightly different areas. One could spawn after the point of no return, cornering the survivors and killing them will little effort, while the other one spawns before it, so the survivors have the open room to backtrack and kite the tank. Again, Versus wasnâ€™t balanced to being with, but this element makes Left 4 Dead 2 versus almost bad. Because of how often this â€œpoint of no returnâ€ is used, youâ€™ll probably be seeing this issue very commonly. I donâ€™t play versus that much, and even Iâ€™ve seen this happen more times than Iâ€™m comfortable with.

Even not considering the newer special infected and guns, Left 4 Dead 1 wasnâ€™t perfectly transferred to the second game. The first one had a bit more of a counter strike mod feeling, whereas the second one really feels like itâ€™s own game. I actually donâ€™t consider this a place where Left 4 Dead 2 is superior. Itâ€™s a matter of personal preference which game feels better to play. So, despite everything Iâ€™ve said, there are reasons that purchasing this game as opposed to playing the same maps in the sequel make sense, but that is an incredibly niche factor that only a few people would even care about.



So, again, do I recommend the game? I guess between recommending it and not recommending it, Iâ€™d say I do, as itâ€™s a great game, but I feel like in almost every way that matters, the sequel outshines it, and has made it little more than a redundant purchase these days. .

Can't find a good server to play online now, but you can still have fun playing with your friends or with AI bots.

Maybe join some steam groups for modded servers where you can play versus with bots without being shut down.

But I highly recommend to buy Left 4 Dead 2 instead of Left 4 Dead for it contains all the maps, characters with improved graphics, addons, more game modes, weapons, zombie types, etc.

I revived my Half-Life game after many years and noticed Left 4 Dead in the bundle. I was hooked from the first try and just can't get enough. If you're a first person shooter type of nut and not up to date with the high end expensive gpu's and systems, this game worked excellent on a PC from 2006 with GTS 450 gpu, Win 7 64bit, 8GB ram, 250G SSD, 3.73GHZ Intel cpu, 975XBX Intel board. I highly recommend this game.
